snippet: What began as a vicious if obscure fight over land and power between Muslims and an indigenous tribe in a remote state has set off panic among northeastern migrants across India.
abstract: Thousands of migrants from India's distant northeastern states are fleeing en masse, panicked by a seemingly growing conflict between Muslims and the indigenous Bodo tribe in the remote state of Assam; exodus has been fueled by unfounded rumors, spread by text messages and social media, that warned of attacks by Muslims against migrants.
lead_paragraph: What began as a vicious if obscure fight over land and power between Muslims and an indigenous tribe in a remote state has set off panic among northeastern migrants across India.

headline.seo: Panic Radiates From Indian State of Assam
headline.main: Panic Seizes India as a Region’s Strife Radiates
headline.print_headline: Panic Seizes India as a Region’s Strife Radiates
